Question for LOng-Time Members
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2004 Topics (Year of the Venture): Question for LOng-Time Members
By Lisa Shock on Friday, November 5, 2004 - 10:29 pm:

I was wondering if I held a gathering at a hotel in Phoenix (Paradise Valley, precisely) if people would be interested in showing up for a couple days. I am thinking about possibly August 5-6, 2005. I have in mind an all-suites hotel where rooms run about $90 a night. I'd get a room to use as a hospitality suite (and reserve it for the 3rd - 7th to help out people checking in/out), and host some tourneys, bring my Japanese PS2 and show off some Japanese Tecmo games, and a few other events. My question right now is, would anyone actually show up - would another date in summer be better?

By torey luvullo on Saturday, November 6, 2004 - 06:16 am:

unfortunately, my schedule is always up in the air. it is difficult for me to predict exactly when i will be able to take any time away from what is now our twin jobs.

By Petit-Trot on Saturday, November 6, 2004 - 08:52 am:

I'm always up for social gatherings. But in truth, ranching would be one of the last things I'd want to do.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, November 6, 2004 - 10:31 am:

Ok, PT, point taken. The hotel is in an area where there is a lot to do. There are all sorts of restaraunts to hang out in, a mall to visit, a big comic store, plus hotel amenities like the pool and jacuzzi.

I just figured that some people might enjoy a few live tourneys, especially some of the people with 'grudges' (and MRA2 players who have never had a chance for a tourney). And, since I do own a wide assortment of Tecmo's Japanese games and the Japanese PS2, people might want to see what some of the differences in the MR games are, plus get a look at games that were Japan only, like Angel Eyes. We could even play the MR CCG game. And, there is a chance I could get a special guest to drop by.

There would still be time for socializing, I just thought that people would be interested in a few MR related activities. You would not have to attend the activities, you could always go over to Atomic Comics and enter a HeroClix tournament.

Torey, I understand. You may have to sneak out to get here, or may not be able to attend at all. I was simply hoping that an early announcement would help people schedule vacation time.
